quotes: After having been deputy Member of Storting (Parliament) for the Labour Party in Oslo since 1989
meeting permanently since 1991
Stoltenberg was elected full Member of Parliament in the 1993 general elections
He held this post until Thorbjørn Jagland’s government took over in October 1996
When Jagland’s government stepped down after the 1997 general elections
In February 2000 he succeeded Jagland as Labour’s parliamentary leader
Thus it was Stoltenberg who was asked to form government when Bondevik’s government resigned in March 2000
Following the 2001 general elections it resigned
In the autumn of 2002 he succeeded Thorbjørn Jagland as leader of the Norwegian Labour Party
In 2001 Stoltenberg became member of the board of the Global Vaccine Fund
Following the 2005 general elections Stoltenberg returned as prime minister
This was Labour’s first coalition government since Einar Gerhardsen’s short-lived government of June-November 1945
In 2006 Stoltenberg was one of the leaders of a high-level UN panel
In the 2009 Storting elections
In the 2013 Storting elections
On 16 October 2013 the shift took place between Stoltenberg's Second Government and Conservative leader Erna Solberg's Government
On 28 March 2014 Stoltenberg was elected to succeed Denmark’s Anders Fogh Rasmussen as secretary general of NATO
